body:
Hi Romuald,

Thank you for helping with the OS X build. The start does not look encouraging, for sure, but on the other hand I encountered the same problems when building it for the first time on linux, and it proved to be much easier to solve them them I thought. Most of these errors are identical (missing some additional template or typename keywords, etc) which is easy to eat through them. Seems like CLANG is even more strict than GCC, which is already much more strict than MSVC (if you ask me, it is way to much strictness, but this seems to be only my opinion). The problem is that I do not have a OS X machine. I have two options, either I try to install clang on ubuntu and try to fix some of the problems like this, or better try to install OS X in a virtual machine (which I do not know even if is possible). I will look into this!

Thanks,
Dan

Hi Dan, 

yes, clang is more strict than the other compilers (but on the other hand OS X does not handle case sensitive system, so strictness on OS X is relative ... ). 

Using clang on other system could solve some of the issues but not all I think. There are errors with the use of some unavailable features (due to POSIX requirement for pthread for ex) that can not be seen without a full OS X system. 

I don't know how can I help you because I don't know if all the above features are needed or not (generally pthread priority is unneeded), moreover my solution is to use standard language capability (std::thread or at least OpenMP that is transparent if unable on underlaying system) instead of system library. 

I tried to compile a gcc on OS X  and test openMVS compilation but without success. I can go further but it still fails and that's why I say installing a compiler on other system may help but not solve all the issues.

Yours,
Romuald.

Indeed, pthread might not be needed or at least easy to replace with std components. Believe it or not the SEACAVE library was started loooong time before std had any thread capabilities, so I was forced to implement them myself on both windows and linux. Now these can be replaced by the new std components, but I am not sure if will be easier to do that or to try to fix the pthread problem.

Anyway, I will look into it.

I've added fixes to support OS X.

Please test it on your machine, as I added the fixes blindly, with no MAC machine to actually test it.

Thanks!

I'll try your change as soon as possible. But not before this week end.

Thanks for your reply !
Thank you!

Hi,

Did you try the commit of yesterday on development branch?

Thanks!

On 24-Sep-15 10:13, Romain Janvier wrote:

> Hi,
> I'm using openMVS successfully for about nearly one month, thank you 
> for all your work ! All modules work perfectly except for the 
> RefineMesh one. It systematically throws a segfault....
> 
> RefineMesh SfM/statue_data_mesh.mvs
> 08:58:31 [App ] Build date: Sep 24 2015, 08:56:46
> 08:58:31 [App ] CPU: Intel(R) Xeon(R) CPU E5-2620 v2 @ 2.10GHz
> 08:58:31 [App ] RAM: 62.87GB Physical Memory 29.80GB Virtual Memory
> 08:58:31 [App ] OS: Linux 3.13.0-64-generic (x86_64)
> 08:58:31 [App ] SSE & AVX compatible CPU & OS detected
> 08:58:31 [App ] Command line: SfM/statue_mesh.mvs
> Erreur de segmentation (core dumped)
> 
> I'm wondering if someone else running openMVS on Linux has already 
> experienced the same issue.
> Regards,
> R.
> 
> —
> Reply to this email directly or view it on GitHub 
> https://github.com/cdcseacave/openMVS/issues/12.

thanks,
Yes.
the issue is present on all revisions since you publish this module
R.
...and on alll my datasets (small: 10 image to large: 1600 images)
I found the problem, it is a bug in the gcc compiler. Till I push the change, please delete & on the line 449 from SceneRefine.cpp
thanks ! It works now.

please share your thoughts on using the library
and if you get some nice results (and possible) please share them with all of us :)

My current OSX bottleneck is a CMake issue (haven't even gotten to the good stuff yet):

```
EIGEN_DIR=/usr/local/Cellar/eigen/3.2.4/ EIGEN_INCLUDE_DIR=/usr/local/Cellar/eigen/3.2.4/include/ VCG_ROOT=/Users/meekohi/vcglib/ cmake -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RELEASE -G "Xcode" . ../openMVS/
```

but

```
-- Eigen 3.2.5 found (include: /usr/local/include/eigen3)
-- OpenCV 2.4.12 found (include: /usr/local/include/opencv;/usr/local/include;/usr/local/share/OpenCV/include)
-- CGAL found (include: /usr/local/Cellar/cgal/4.6.2/include)
-- VCG  found (include: /Users/meekohi/vcglib)
CMake Error at /usr/local/share/CERES/CeresConfig.cmake:85 (MESSAGE):
  Failed to find Ceres - Missing required Ceres dependency: Eigen version
  3.2.4, please set EIGEN_INCLUDE_DIR.
Call Stack (most recent call first):
  /usr/local/share/CERES/CeresConfig.cmake:154 (CERES_REPORT_NOT_FOUND)
  build/Modules/FindCERES.cmake:31 (include)
  libs/MVS/CMakeLists.txt:15 (FIND_PACKAGE)
```

Any advice how to force Cmake to use the correct version of Eigen for Ceres?

I did not encounter this problem on windows and linux, so I do not know why it doesn't find it. However, I am almost sure that is you modify /usr/local/share/CERES/CeresConfig.cmake so that it does not try to find eigen anymore, it will work, since it found it earlier and it will use that version. By the way, you seem to have two versions of Eigen 3.2.4 and 3.2.5, maybe this can create a problem.
@Meekohi I use Eigen version from macports and I don't have any error with ceres. Maybe the manual installation is not correctly handled by ceres.
@rperrot Please make sure you are using the latest version of the code. That means the develop branch on https://github.com/cdcseacave/openMVS. All the errors you listed above were fixed.

Sorry, I though it was fixed on default branch. 

But unfortunately error is now on cmake :-( 

```
CMake Error: The following variables are used in this project, but they are set to NOTFOUND.
Please set them or make sure they are set and tested correctly in the CMake files:
CUDA_CUDART_LIBRARY (ADVANCED)
    linked by target "MVS" in directory /Users/rperrot/Prog/openMVS/src/libs/MVS

-- Configuring incomplete, errors occurred!
```

Cuda is now a dependency ? I'm on OS X with AMD GPU, so Cuda will be hard to install ... 

Sorry, but I give up !

no, CUDA is not required, just add the following line at line 67 in CMakeLists.txt
        set(CUDA_LIBRARIES "")
I cleaned and fixed the code for Linux, and I think OS X will benefit from this as well. When you can, please try again to compile it on Apple.

isinf/isnan issues are still there (prefix them with std::). I can go a little bit further but : 

```
/Users/rperrot/Prog/openMVS/src/libs/Common/Util.cpp:603:no such instruction: `xgetbv'
/Users/rperrot/Prog/openMVS/src/libs/Common/Util.cpp:603:no such instruction: `xgetbv'
```

I saw it's on check AVX. This error seams strange because my CPU ( core i7 4980HQ ) supports AVX and AVX2. 

But why don't you use cmake possibilities to check CPU availability ? Using something like this could simplify a lot the uses : 

https://github.com/openMVG/openMVG/blob/master/src/cmakeFindModules/OptimizeForArchitecture.cmake

Probably the compiler flags are not set properly in my CMake files to activate AVX support.

As for your solution for checking AVX support, it is only at compile time as far as I understand, while the check I do in the Util file is at runtime.

Please feel free to post a push request with the right fixes for OSX. It is very hard for me to fix them blindly with no actual machine to test on.

Thanks!

Okay after learning a considerable amount more about CMake than intended, this solves the Eigen issues:

```
VCG_ROOT=/Users/meekohi/vcglib/ EIGEN_ROOT=/usr/local/Cellar/eigen/3.2.4/include/eigen3/ cmake -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RELEASE -G "Xcode" . ../openMVS/
```

however I'm getting an issue with dependency with openMVG:

```
CMake Error at /Users/meekohi/openmvg_build/OpenMVGConfig.cmake:46 (MESSAGE):
  Failed to find OPENMVG - OpenMVG install root:
  /Users/meekohi/openmvg_build.  Cannot find openMVG include files.
Call Stack (most recent call first):
  /Users/meekohi/openmvg_build/OpenMVGConfig.cmake:82 (OPENMVG_REPORT_NOT_FOUND)
  apps/InterfaceOpenMVG/CMakeLists.txt:6 (FIND_PACKAGE)
```

`/Users/meekohi/openmvg_build/OpenMVGConfig.cmake` uses the variable `CURRENT_ROOT_INSTALL_DIR` a bunch which seems like it would not be defined in this context? Is there some trick for specifying where openMVG is installed? The source is in `~/openMVG/src` and build is in `~/openmvg_build`.

It remembers a thing that I talked to @pmoulon is that openMVG source dir must be specified using absolute path (relative path doesn't work)

I used this option as stated in the openMVG doc: -DOpenMVG_DIR:STRING="YourInstallPath"/share/openMVG/cmake
Thanks, I have updated the WIKI with a not for user specific path: https://github.com/OpenMVS/openMVS/wiki/Building

Starting to understand now. This assumes all the include files have been dumped into some directory by running `make install` (I generally prefer not to do this with code that is changing frequently, but seems required in this case)

`make install` does not work on OSX, but you can do `cmake -P cmake_install.cmake` instead.

Now the following CMake command works for me:

```
VCG_ROOT=/Users/meekohi/vcglib/ EIGEN_ROOT=/usr/local/Cellar/eigen/3.2.4/include/eigen3/ cmake -DCMAKE_BUILD_TYPE=RELEASE -DOpenMVG_DIR=/Users/meekohi/openmvg_build/openMVG_install/share/openMVG/cmake/ -G "Xcode" . ../openMVS/
```

Next I run `xcodebuild -configuration Release` but there are several compiler errors. These I can look into in more detail and see if I can produce some patches. (gist is at https://gist.github.com/Meekohi/2c74b17edee14f4e0ee5 if anyone wants to look)
@Meekohi Have you used the develop branch?
Yes this is the `develop` branch for both openMVG and openMVS.
